notes: On 20 January 2017, Taliban militants clashed with Afghan military forces, killing 1 soldier and injuring 1, in Gizab district, Urozgan.

During clashes between the Police Forces of Afghanistan and the Islamic State on 25-Feb-2017 in the Sherbar district (coded Shibar) of Bamyan a key Taliban leader, 3 police, and one of the police drivers were killed.

A Ministry of Interior press release on March 12, 2017, announced that 31 armed insurgents were killed (coded across 4 events) in the previous 24 hours in military operations in Wardak, Nangarhar, Daykundi, and Urozgan Provinces. 2 other insurgents were reported wounded and 12 captured.
The Taliban website reports that Taliban militants carried out an attack on Afghan forces in the Dahan Dray area of Saifan district of Bamian province killing 1 soldier.
On 19 May 2017, a gun fight erupted between Afghan soldiers, injuring 2 soldiers, in the admin center of Kajran district, Daykundi.
Taliban militants carried out attacks on 2 Afghan forces' security posts in the Duab and Mekh-e Zarin area of Kohmard district in Bamian province killing 4 soldiers.
On 09 July 2017, Taliban militants ambushed and killed 1 Afghan soldier, and injured 2, in Ajristan district, Daykundi.
On 24 August 2017, Taliban militants ambushed and killed 1 Afghan military commander, in Gizab district, Urozgan.

source: Afghan Islamic Press News Agency; Pajhwok Afghan News
notes: 80-100 Taliban fighters attacked security checkpoints in the Baghak area of Shibar District on the evening of September 29, 2017, and the clashes lasted 12 hours into the next day. 5 Taliban and a policeman were killed (coded across 2 events); the Taliban claimed that many government soldiers also suffered casualties.
On 30 October 2017, Taliban militants shot and killed 3 policemen trying to reopen a road that Taliban had closed off in Shibar (Ghandak) district, Bamyan.
Agreement: The shadow district governor from the Taliban for Kahmard District, Bamyan Province, along with his bodyguard joined the peace process, as reported on November 23, 2017.
On 4 December 2017, Taliban militants ambushed and killed an Afghan soldier, in Sangah Shaykh of Gizab district, Urozgan. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 1 fatality).
On 7 January 2018, Taliban fighters clashed with presumed military forces in the Sowf area of Kajran district, Daykundi. 4 of the soldiers, including a commander, were killed.
On 23 February 2018, 7 Afghan and 5 Taliban fighters were wounded when the latter attacked an Afghan post in the Manari area of Kajran district of Daykundi province. No fatalities were reported.
On 17 March 2018, a Taliban Ied blast killed 2 policemen in Manari area of Kajaran district, Daykundi.
On 18 April 2018, 4 soldiers were killed and 5 more wounded during clashes with Taliban militants in Dary area of Gizab district, Urozgan province.
On 13 May 2018, Taliban militants attacked the vehicle of an Afghan military commander, in Kahmard district, Bamyan. No casualties reported by source.
On 11 June 2018, Taliban militants attacked a military convoy in Shibar (Ghandak) district, Bamyan. No casualties were reported.

Taliban militants attacked security forces in Ashpasha village, Kahmard District, Bamyan Province over a period of 4 days, as reported by the provincial police chief on July 30. The security forces repelled the attack and inflicted heavy casualties on the Taliban; further details not provided.
On 6 August 2018, 5 Taliban commanders were killed when they attacked an Afghan police checkpoint in the Patou area of Daykundi province.

As reported on 09-September-2018, 4 Afghan Military Forces were killed and 2 wounded in an attack by Taliban militants in Ghazni city, Ghazni district, Ghazni province. 1 tank was destroyed in the attack.
On 6 October 2018, 1 Afghan Military commander and 2 other soldiers were killed and 3 more wounded in attacks by Taliban militants in the Kangari area of Kajaran district, Daykundi province.

actor1: Police Forces of Afghanistan (2014-2021) Afghan Local Police
notes: On 15 November 2018, 6 local policemen were killed while on patrol following an attack by Taliban militants in the Sowf area of Kajran district, Daykundi.

On 25 December 2018, Afghan military forces conducted ground operations with support from air forces against suspected Taliban and/or IS militants in the Pato area of Gizab district, Urozgan province. 7 militants were killed.
On 3 January 2019, 2 Afghan Policemen were killed by Taliban militants in Ghazni city.

On 3 February 2019, 4 Afghan soldiers were killed and wounded by Taliban militants in the Kagh Dara area of Gizab district, Urozgan province. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ-reported unknown fatalities coded as half).
On 17 March 2019, 1 Afghan soldier was wounded by a mine blast conducted by Taliban militants in the Bala Dasht area of Kajran district, Daykundi province.
On 13 April 2019, 2 Afghan soldiers were killed and 1 was wounded by Taliban militants in the Dari area of Nili (Daykundi) district, Daykundi province.
As reported on 10-May-2019, 8 civilians were killed by a roadside mine blast conducted by unidentified armed militants in Daykundi province.
On 30 June 2019, Taliban militants attacked 4 Afghan military posts, in Kandu-ye Bala of Kajran district, Daykundi. No casualties reported by source.
Reported on 02 July 2019, Taliban militants repelled an Afghan military attack, in Kahmard district, Bamyan. No casualties reported by source.
On 7 August 2019, 12 Afghan soldiers were killed (coded across 4 events) in Taliban attacks in Kunduz, Baghlan, Badakhshan, and Bamyan provinces.
On 1 September 2019, at least 4 'Arbakis' including a commander were killed following an ambush by Taliban militants in Sayghan district, Bamyan.

source: New York Times; Voice of Jihad
notes: On 03 October 2019, Taliban militants attacked a police post, killing 2 policemen, and injuring 3, in Baghak of Qala I Naw district, Badghis.
As reported on 21 November 2019, 4 Taliban militants were killed and 5 were wounde during clashes with Afghan forces in Gizab district, Urozgan.
As reported on 27 December 2019, 7 Taliban militants were killed and 1 was wounded following an attack by Afghan forces in the Baladash area of Kajran district, Daykundi.
Looting: On 23 January 2020, Taliban militants looted 2 food trucks in Kajran district, Daykundi. They kidnapped and later released the drivers.

On 1 February 2020, at least 5 local policemen were killed and wounded by a Taliban-planted mine in the Sangah Shaykh area of Gizab district, Urozgan. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 2-5 fatalities).
On 22 March 2020, 4 Afghan security forces were killed and 7 civilians were injured after Taliban militants attacked police checkpoints in Kajran district, Daikundi province.
On 28 April 2020, a drone strike by NATO forces [assumed US military] killed 1 civilian, in Bala Dasht village of Kajran district, Daykundi. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 1).
On 31 May 2020, 21 Taliban militants and 2 Afghan soldiers were killed during an attack by Taliban insurgents on security posts in the Dawazda Imam and Khaksar areas of the Kajran district, Daykundi.

On 2 June 2020, Taliban militants attacked Afghan military forces in Kijran district, Daykundi province. At least 21 Taliban militants were killed or wounded, 2 soldiers were also killed. Unknown Taliban fatalities were coded as 0. 2 fatalities were coded in total.

On 15 July 2020, 12 Taliban militants were killed and 6 others were wounded by security and defense forces as they retaliated against a Taliban attack in Sartagab area of Gizab (Pato) district, Daykundi province.

On 24 August 2020, 1 Afghan security personnel commander was killed and 2 guards were wounded when his vehicle hit a Taliban-planted landmine in the Zain Kala area of Gizab district, Urozgan. Fatalities coded as 0 (VoJ reported 1).

source: Voice of Jihad; New York Times
notes: On 21 September 2020, Taliban militants attacked Afghan police forces killing 2 policemen and injuring 1 other in Shibar district, Bamyan. VoJ claimed killing 4 security forces and injuring 4. Fatalities coded as 2 (VoJ reported 4).

source: Pajhwok Afghan News; Twitter; Afghan Ministry of Defense
notes: On 21 October 2020, 17 Taliban militants were killed and 10 were wounded when Afghan forces repulsed their attacks in Gizab district, Urozgan.

source: Afghan Islamic Press News Agency; AP; Khaama Press; TOLO News; Pajhwok Afghan News; Xinhua; New York Times
notes: On 24 November 2020, at least 17 civilians were killed and more than 59 were wounded (58 civilians and 1 policeman) in two an unidentified militants'-planted roadside bomb blasts in the bazaar area of the provincial capital city of Bamyan province. It's unclear who was behind the attack. 3 suspects were arrested and authorities blamed the Taliban, Taliban denied involvement.
On 6 December 2020, 5 Taliban militants were killed and 4 wounded in Afghan Military forces' airstrike in Gizab district, Urozgan province.
